parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Fresh, new, unused, novel. Of uncertain affinity; new
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To go down, come down, either from the sky or from higher land, descend. From kata and the base of basis; to descend.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
From a primary but obsolete verb nupto; a young married woman, including a betrothed girl; by implication, a son's wife.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To put into order; I decorate, deck, adorn. From kosmos; to put in proper order, i.e. Decorate; specially, to snuff.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
